definition: to extinguish or put out/to go out (of a fire etc)/to exterminate or wipe out/to drown

sentences.english: The house was eaten up by flame.
Let not the waterflood overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me up.
sentences.chinese: 求你不要讓波濤淹沒我，也不要讓深水吞滅我。

sentences.english: In his wrath the Lord will swallow them up, and his fire will consume them.
sentences.chinese: 耶和華要在他的震怒中吞滅他們。

sentences.english: Why are you silent while the wicked swallow up those more righteous than themselves?
sentences.chinese: 惡人吞滅比自己公義的人，你爲甚麼緘默呢？

sentences.english: You stretched out your right hand and the earth swallowed them.
sentences.chinese: 你伸出右手，地便吞滅他們。

sentences.english: Who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire?
sentences.chinese: 我們中間誰能與吞滅的火同住。

sentences.english: But a certain dreadful expectation of judgment, and the rage of a fire which shall consume the adversaries.
sentences.chinese: 只有一種等待審判的怕情，和勢將吞滅叛逆者的烈火。
